result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Dale Michael Johnson was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to Probation today July 13, 2015.
Probation may be transferred to Minnesota.

  
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

Apply bond on file.
Defendant to meet with the payment clerk on balance owed.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Kenneth N. Sortedahl, DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski, DF: Dale Michael Johnson appeared.  Court called at 2:15 p.m.  Case recalled at 2:15 p.m. from this morning.  Set for STC.  Includes case 14CF403 & 14CF426.  Attorney Kucinski files an Affidavit with the Court with Statement by DE's amending this charge to an OWI (4th offense).  Attorney Kucinski recites the agreement.  State makes statement.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1  in the amended Information.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of the amended Ct. 1 . On motion of the State, Crt dismisses 14CF426. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:


S/W 2 years probation with conditions
- Court grants probation can be transfered to Minnesota
- DE sentenced to 60 days in the St. Croix County Jail
- Credit for 33 days time served
- Credit for 35 days for treatment in Salvation Army
- AODA and follow thorugh with any recommended treatment
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, 
- 30 months driver's license revocation
- 30 months IID
- F/F of $1,694.00 apply money on file
- Court grants a payment plan and DE to meet with the payment clerk
- DE to report to probation by today 07/13/15
- 20 days to appeal
Plea/sentencing hearing at 07-30-2015 11:00 am

Attorney Kucinski gives update.  There is a resolution and asking to set out for Plea/Sentencing.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 11:52 a.m. lw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Motion hearing on July 13, 2015 at 11:15 am.
